channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ATM Software Flaws Left Piles of Cash for Anyone Who Knew to Look
item.description: Six vulnerabilities in ATM-maker Diebold Nixdorf’s popular Vynamic Security Suite could have been exploited to control ATMs using “relatively simplistic attacks.”

item.title: The X exodus that wasn’t
item.description: When digging into the data to determine how large the exodus everyone on Threads is talking about actually is, we oddly came up short. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 19 Best Back-to-School Deals (2024): Backpacks, Chargers, Laptops
item.description: It's time to put away the pool noodles and get those butts back in seats. Save on backpacks, iPads, laptops, and more.

item.title: Substack now lets anyone publish posts, even if they don’t have a newsletter
item.description: Substack is opening up to more users with its recent announcement that anyone can now publish content on its platform without setting up a publication. With the change, Substack is likely looking to attract more types of writers and content creators, not just people who are interested in creating regularly distributed long-form written pieces. While […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The 14 Best Amazon Echo and Alexa Speakers (2024): We've Tested Them All
item.description: We’ve rounded up our favorites, including third-party devices like the Sonos Era and a voice-enabled Yamaha soundbar.

item.title: China’s autonomous vehicle startup WeRide prepares for a US IPO
item.description: WeRide, a Chinese autonomous vehicle company, is officially gearing up for a U.S. public debut, over a year after China started easing its effective ban of foreign IPOs. WeRide registered 1 billion American Depository Receipts (ADRs) at a maximum price of $0.05, with the aggregate offering coming in at $50 million, per a Friday filing […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 'Crush House' Is a Game For People Who Love Drama
item.description: The “thirst person shooter” puts a dark spin on reality TV.

item.title: How a cybersecurity researcher befriended, then doxed, the leader of LockBit ransomware gang
item.description: Jon DiMaggio used sockpuppet accounts, then his own identity, to infiltrate LockBit and gain the trust of its alleged admin, Dmitry Khoroshev. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: He Started Out as the ‘Dear Abby’ of Grindr. Now Everyone Wants His Advice
item.description: With the advice column ¡Hola Papi!, JP Brammer tackles life’s most eccentric and heart-wrenching issues—like what to do after realizing your fiance is catfishing you.

item.title: AI founders play musical chairs
item.description: Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Want it in your inbox every Friday? Sign up here. This week we are looking at AI founders who are playing musical chairs, a massive defense tech investment, and more issues at Techstars. Let’s get into it. Most […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
